仸字的基本解释

仸
yǎo
瘦弱。
弯曲，卷曲。

仸
fó
古同“佛”。

仸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fó］
［《廣韻》符弗切，入物，奉。］
“仏1”的今字。亦作“仸1”。
(1)佛陀的简称。本义为“觉”。佛教徒用为对其创始人释迦牟尼的尊称。
(2)泛指佛经中所说的一切佛陀。
(3)佛教徒称修行圆满而成道者。
(4)比喻慈悲的人。
(5)佛像。
(6)佛教；佛学。
(7)佛经。
[②]［fú］
［《集韻》敷勿切，入勿，敷。］
见“仿佛”。
[③]［fú］
［《集韻》符勿切，入勿，奉。］
(1)通“拂”。逆转；拗转。
(2)通“拂”。违背，乖逆。
[④]［bó］
［《集韻》薄没切，入没，並。］
通“勃1”。
兴起貌。
[⑤]［bì］
［《集韻》薄宓切，入質，並。］
(1)见“佛5肸”、“佛5貍”。
(2)通“弼”。辅助。《诗·周颂·敬之》：“佛時仔肩，示我顯德行。”郑玄笺：“佛，輔也。”陆德明释文：“鄭音弼。”马瑞辰通释：“古'弼'字其音均與'佛'近，故'弼'可借作'佛'也。”一说，佛训为“大”。《诗·周颂·敬之》“佛時仔肩”毛传：“佛，

仸字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　仸； 康熙笔画：6； 页码：页94第21
【廣韻】【集韻】?於兆切，音夭。仸僑，不伸也。　又尫弱貌。

仸字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
仸字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Arbitrarily
yǎo
emaciated.
Bend, curl.
Arbitrarily
fó
Ancient "Buddha".
Arbitrarily
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fó］
["Guangyun" Fu Fuqi, into the object, Feng. ]
The present character of "仏1". Also known as "仸1".
(1) The abbreviation of Buddha. The original meaning is "jue". Buddhists use it as a respectful name for its founder, Sakyamuni.
(2) It refers to all Buddhas mentioned in Buddhist scriptures.
(3) Buddhists call them those who have attained complete spiritual practice.
(4) A metaphor for a compassionate person.
(5) Buddha statues.
(6) Buddhism; Buddhism.
(7) Buddhist scriptures.
[②]［fú］
["Jiyun" do not cut, do not enter, apply. ]
See "as if".
[③] [fú]
["Jiyun" symbol do not cut, do not enter, bong. ]
(1) Through "Whis". Reversal
(2) Through "Whis". Violate, obediently.
[④]［bó］
["Jiyun" is not cut, enters, and merges. ]
Link "Bo 1".
Rise up appearance.
[⑤]［bì］
["Ji Yun" Bo Mi cuts, enters the quality, and merges. ]
(1) See "Buddha 5 palpitations" and "Buddha 5 raccoons".
(2) Through "Bee". Assisted. "Poetry·Zhou Song·Jingzhi": "Buddha's shoulders show me showing virtue." Zheng Xuanjian: "Buddha, auxiliary." Lu Deming explained the text: "Zheng Yinbi." Ma Ruichen explained: "Ancient'Bi' character Its sound is similar to'Buddha', so'Bei' can be borrowed as'Buddha'." In other words, the Buddha's precept is "big". "Poetry·Zhou Song·Jingzhi" "Buddha Shizai Shoulder" Mao Chuan: "Buddha,
